paper_metadata.title: Genome-wide association study of circulating retinol levels
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Caucasian individuals from two cohorts (ATBC and PLCO)

functional_data.summary: The variant rs1667255 in the TTR gene is associated with serum retinol levels.

variants.segregation_data: The association with retinol levels suggests potential segregation with retinol concentration.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on GWAS findings.
variants.additional_notes: The variant did not reach statistical significance in replication studies.
key_quotes: rs1667255 did not reach statistical significance in the replication data set (P =0.08, Table 1)
The combined meta-analysis yielded significance at the P =6.35× 10−14 level.

tables_processed.table_caption: SNPs associated with serum retinol at P< 5 × 10−7-GWAS and replication studies

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted from the main text and tables, focusing solely on the TTR gene.
